column4: the link you gave me doesnt seem to be quite what i am looking for...
sound works with _some_ apps. but not all
i tried a diff liveCD of diff distro and the sound works fine
firefox works and i tried a few games and they worked also
but xchat has no sounds and kismet has no sounds
maybe kismet (being qt iirc needs arts running)
what do you mean by qt iirc and arts?
arts is a sound server like esd some apps need one to be running kde uses arts and gnome esd
can i load a KDE environment ontop/next to my ubuntu w/ gnome?
or possibly switch to KDE without loosing all my settings
not wise, maybe tyou can configure kismet to use alsa directly and all other apps that doesn't work
what if i just switch to KDE? would that require a new install?
no, install kubuntu-desktop but it seems like no worth the effort just for hearing kismet
i agree. but i wouldnt mind seeing the difference in the two.
